<div id="objects.xhtml_text" class="section">

## Text

<div id="objects.xhtml_create-text-object" class="section">

### Create Text Object

Create text object or add to <span class="pre">`BuildSketch`</span>
using <a href="#objects.xhtml_objects_sketch.Text"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="objects_sketch.Text"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">Text</code></span></a>:

<img src="_images/text.png" class="align-center" style="width: 80%;"
alt="_images/text.png" />

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    text = "The quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dog."
    Text(text, 10)

</div>

</div>

Specify font and style. Fonts have up to 4 font styles:
<span class="pre">`REGULAR`</span>, <span class="pre">`BOLD`</span>,
<span class="pre">`ITALIC`</span>,
<span class="pre">`BOLDITALIC`</span>. All fonts can use
<span class="pre">`ITALIC`</span> even if only
<span class="pre">`REGULAR`</span> is defined.

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    Text(text, 10, "Arial", font_style=FontStyle.BOLD)

</div>

</div>

Find available fonts on system and available styles:

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    from pprint import pprint
    pprint(available_fonts())

</div>

</div>

<div class="highlight-text notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    [
     ...
     Font(name='Arial', styles=('REGULAR', 'BOLD', 'BOLDITALIC', 'ITALIC')),
     Font(name='Arial Black', styles=('REGULAR',)),
     Font(name='Arial Narrow', styles=('REGULAR', 'BOLD', 'BOLDITALIC', 'ITALIC')),
     Font(name='Arial Rounded MT Bold', styles=('REGULAR',)),
     ...
    ]

</div>

</div>

Font faces like
<span class="pre">`"Arial`</span>` `<span class="pre">`Black"`</span> or
<span class="pre">`"Arial`</span>` `<span class="pre">`Narrow"`</span>
must be specified by name rather than
<span class="pre">`FontStyle`</span>:

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    Text(text, 10, "Arial Black")

</div>

</div>

Specify a font file directly by filename:

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    Text(text, 10, font_path="DejaVuSans.ttf")

</div>

</div>

Fonts added via <span class="pre">`font_path`</span> persist in the font
list:

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    Text(text, 10, font_path="SourceSans3-VariableFont_wght.ttf")
    pprint([f.name for f in available_fonts() if "Source Sans" in f.name])
    Text(text, 10, "Source Sans 3 Medium")

</div>

</div>

<div class="highlight-text notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    ['Source Sans 3',
     'Source Sans 3 Black',
     'Source Sans 3 ExtraBold',
     'Source Sans 3 ExtraLight',
     ...]

</div>

</div>

Add a font file to <span class="pre">`FontManager`</span> if a font is
reused in the script or contains multiple font faces:

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    new_font_faces = FontManager().register_font("Roboto-VariableFont_wdth,wght.ttf")
    pprint(new_font_faces)
    Text(text, 10, "Roboto")
    Text(text, 10, "Roboto Black")

</div>

</div>

<div class="highlight-text notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    ['Roboto Thin',
     'Roboto ExtraLight',
     'Roboto Light',
     'Roboto',
      ...]

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="objects.xhtml_placement" class="section">

### Placement

Multiline text has two methods of alignment.
<span class="pre">`text_align`</span> aligns the text relative to its
<span class="pre">`Location`</span>:

<img src="_images/text_align.png" class="align-center"
style="width: 80%;" alt="_images/text_align.png" />

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    Text(text, 10, text_align=(TextAlign.LEFT, TextAlign.TOPFIRSTLINE))

</div>

</div>

<span class="pre">`align`</span> aligns the object bounding box relative
to its <span class="pre">`Location`</span> *after* text alignment:

<img src="_images/align.png" class="align-center" style="width: 80%;"
alt="_images/align.png" />

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    text = "The quick brown\nfox jumped over\nthe lazy dog."
    Text(text, 10, align=(Align.MIN, Align.MIN))

</div>

</div>

Place text along an <span class="pre">`Edge`</span> or
<span class="pre">`Wire`</span> with <span class="pre">`path`</span> and
<span class="pre">`position_on_path`</span>:

<img src="_images/path.png" class="align-center" style="width: 80%;"
alt="_images/path.png" />

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    text = "The quick brown fox"
    path = RadiusArc((-50, 0), (50, 0), 100)
    Text(
        text,
        10,
        path=path,
        position_on_path=.5,
        text_align=(TextAlign.CENTER, TextAlign.BOTTOM)
    )

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="objects.xhtml_single-line-fonts" class="section">

### Single Line Fonts

<span class="pre">`"singleline"`</span> is a special font referencing
<span class="pre">`Relief`</span>` `<span class="pre">`SingleLine`</span>` `<span class="pre">`CAD`</span>.
Glyphs are represented as single lines rather than filled faces.

<span class="pre">`Text`</span> creates an outlined face by default. The
outline width is controlled by
<span class="pre">`single_line_width`</span>. This operation is slow
with many glyphs.

<img src="_images/outline.png" class="align-center" style="width: 80%;"
alt="_images/outline.png" />

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    Text(text, 10, "singleline")
    Text(text, 10, "singleline", single_line_width=1)

</div>

</div>

Use <span class="pre">`Compound.make_text()`</span> to create
*unoutlined* single-line text. Useful for routing, engraving, or drawing
label paths.

<img src="_images/singleline.png" class="align-center"
style="width: 80%;" alt="_images/singleline.png" />

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    Compound.make_text(text, 10, "singleline")

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="objects.xhtml_common-issues" class="section">

### Common Issues

<div id="objects.xhtml_missing-glyphs-or-invalid-geometry"
class="section">

#### Missing Glyphs or Invalid Geometry

Modern variable-width fonts often contain glyphs with overlapping stroke
outlines, which produce invalid geometry.
<span class="pre">`ocp_vscode`</span> ignores invalid faces.

<img src="_images/missing_glyph.png" class="align-center"
alt="_images/missing_glyph.png" />

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    Text("The", 10, "Source Sans 3 Black")

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="objects.xhtml_filenotfounderror" class="section">

#### FileNotFoundError

Ensure relative <span class="pre">`font_path`</span> specifications are
relative to the *current working directory*.

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="objects.xhtml_custom-objects" class="section">

## Custom Objects

All of the objects presented above were created using one of three base
object classes: <a href="#objects.xhtml_objects_curve.BaseLineObject"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="objects_curve.BaseLineObject"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">BaseLineObject</code></span></a>
, <a href="#objects.xhtml_objects_sketch.BaseSketchObject"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="objects_sketch.BaseSketchObject"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">BaseSketchObject</code></span></a>
, and <a href="#objects.xhtml_objects_part.BasePartObject"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="objects_part.BasePartObject"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">BasePartObject</code></span></a>
. Users can use these base object classes to easily create custom
objects that have all the functionality of the core objects.

<img src="_images/card_box.svg" class="align-center"
alt="_images/card_box.svg" />

Here is an example of a custom sketch object specially created as part
of the design of this playing card storage box
(<span class="pre">`see`</span>` `<span class="pre">`the`</span>` `<span class="pre">`playing_cards.py`</span>` `<span class="pre">`example`</span>):

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    class Club(BaseSketchObject):
        def __init__(
            self,
            height: float,
            rotation: float = 0,
            align: tuple[Align, Align] = (Align.CENTER, Align.CENTER),
            mode: Mode = Mode.ADD,
        ):
            with BuildSketch() as club:
                with BuildLine():
                    l0 = Line((0, -188), (76, -188))
                    b0 = Bezier(l0 @ 1, (61, -185), (33, -173), (17, -81))
                    b1 = Bezier(b0 @ 1, (49, -128), (146, -145), (167, -67))
                    b2 = Bezier(b1 @ 1, (187, 9), (94, 52), (32, 18))
                    b3 = Bezier(b2 @ 1, (92, 57), (113, 188), (0, 188))
                    mirror(about=Plane.YZ)
                make_face()
                scale(by=height / club.sketch.bounding_box().size.Y)
            super().__init__(obj=club.sketch, rotation=rotation, align=align, mode=mode)

</div>

</div>

Here the new custom object class is called
<span class="pre">`Club`</span> and it’s a sub-class of
<a href="#objects.xhtml_objects_sketch.BaseSketchObject"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="objects_sketch.BaseSketchObject"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">BaseSketchObject</code></span></a>
. The <span class="pre">`__init__`</span> method contains all of the
parameters used to instantiate the custom object, specially a
<span class="pre">`height`</span>, <span class="pre">`rotation`</span>,
<span class="pre">`align`</span>, and <span class="pre">`mode`</span> -
your objects may contain a sub or super set of these parameters but
should always contain a <span class="pre">`mode`</span> parameter such
that it can be combined with a builder’s object.

Next is the creation of the object itself, in this case a sketch of the
club suit.

The final line calls the <span class="pre">`__init__`</span> method of
the super class - i.e.
<a href="#objects.xhtml_objects_sketch.BaseSketchObject"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="objects_sketch.BaseSketchObject"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">BaseSketchObject</code></span></a>
with its parameters.

That’s it, now the <span class="pre">`Club`</span> object can be used
anywhere a <a href="#objects.xhtml_objects_sketch.Circle"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="objects_sketch.Circle"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">Circle</code></span></a>
would be used - with either the Algebra or Builder API.

<img src="_images/buildline_example_6.svg" class="align-center"
alt="_images/buildline_example_6.svg" />

</div>

</div>

<div class="clearer">

</div>

</div>

<span id="operations.xhtml"></span>

<div class="body" role="main">

<div id="operations.xhtml_operations" class="section">

# Operations

Operations are functions that take objects as inputs and transform them
into new objects. For example, a 2D Sketch can be extruded to create a
3D Part. All operations are Python functions which can be applied using
both the Algebra and Builder APIs. It’s important to note that objects
created by operations are not affected by
<span class="pre">`Locations`</span>, meaning their position is
determined solely by the input objects used in the operation.

Here are a couple ways to use
<a href="#operations.xhtml_operations_part.extrude"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="operations_part.extrude"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-func docutils literal notranslate">extrude()</code></span></a>,
in Builder and Algebra mode:

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    with BuildPart() as cylinder:
        with BuildSketch():
            Circle(radius)
        extrude(amount=height)

</div>

</div>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    cylinder = extrude(Circle(radius), amount=height)

</div>

</div>

The following table summarizes all of the available operations.
Operations marked as 1D are applicable to BuildLine and Algebra Curve,
2D to BuildSketch and Algebra Sketch, 3D to BuildPart and Algebra Part.

| Operation | Description | 0D | 1D | 2D | 3D | Example |
|----|----|----|----|----|----|----|
| <a href="#operations.xhtml_operations_generic.add"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="operations_generic.add"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-func docutils literal notranslate">add()</code></span></a> | Add object to builder |  | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ | <a href="#introductory_examples.xhtml_ex-16"
class="reference internal"><span class="std std-ref">16</span></a> |

Generic Object: Add Object to Part or Sketch

Add an object to a builder.

BuildPart:  
Edges and Wires are added to pending_edges. Compounds of Face are added
to pending_faces. Solids or Compounds of Solid are combined into the
part.

BuildSketch:  
Edges and Wires are added to pending_edges. Compounds of Face are added
to sketch.

BuildLine:  
Edges and Wires are added to line.

Parameters<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **objects** (<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Edge"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Edge"><em>Edge</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Wire"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Wire"><em>Wire</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Face"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Face"><em>Face</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Solid"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Solid"><em>Solid</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Compound"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Compound"><em>Compound</em></a> *or* *Iterable of*) –
  objects to add

- **rotation** (*float* *\|* *RotationLike,* *optional*) – rotation
  angle for sketch, rotation about each axis for part. Defaults to None.

- **clean** – Remove extraneous internal structure. Defaults to True.

Generic Operation: chamfer

Applies to 2 and 3 dimensional objects.

Chamfer the given sequence of edges or vertices.

Parameters<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **objects** (<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Edge"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Edge"><em>Edge</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Vertex"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Vertex"><em>Vertex</em></a> *or* *Iterable of*) –
  edges or vertices to chamfer

- **length** (*float*) – chamfer size

- **length2** (*float,* *optional*) – asymmetric chamfer size. Defaults
  to None.

- **angle** (*float,* *optional*) – chamfer angle in degrees. Defaults
  to None.

- **reference** (<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Edge"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Edge"><em>Edge</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Face"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Face"><em>Face</em></a>) – identifies the side where
  length is measured. Edge(s) must be part of the face. Vertex/Vertices
  must be part of edge

Raises<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **ValueError** – no objects provided

- **ValueError** – objects must be Edges

- **ValueError** – objects must be Vertices

- **ValueError** – Only one of length2 or angle should be provided

- **ValueError** – reference can only be used in conjunction with
  length2 or angle

Applies to 2 and 3 dimensional objects.

Fillet the given sequence of edges or vertices. Note that vertices on
either end of an open line will be automatically skipped.

Parameters<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **objects** (<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Edge"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Edge"><em>Edge</em></a> *\|*

  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Vertex"><em>Vertex</em></a> *or* *Iterable of*) –
  edges or vertices to fillet

- **radius** (*float*) – fillet size - must be less than 1/2 local width

Raises<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **ValueError** – no objects provided

- **ValueError** – objects must be Edges

- **ValueError** – objects must be Vertices

- **ValueError** – nothing to fillet

Sketch Operation: full_round

Given an edge from a Face/Sketch, modify the face by replacing the given
edge with the arc of the Voronoi largest empty circle that will fit
within the Face. This “rounds off” the end of the object.

Parameters<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **edge** (<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Edge"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Edge"><em>Edge</em></a>) – target Edge to remove

- **invert** (*bool,* *optional*) – make the arc concave instead of
  convex. Defaults to False.

- **voronoi_point_count** (*int,* *optional*) – number of points along
  each edge used to create the voronoi vertices as potential locations
  for the center of the largest empty circle. Defaults to 100.

- **mode** (<a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.Mode"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="build_enums.Mode"><em>Mode</em></a>*,* *optional*) –
  combination mode. Defaults to Mode.REPLACE.

Raises<span class="colon">:</span>  
**ValueError** – Invalid geometry

Returns<span class="colon">:</span>  
the modified shape

Return type<span class="colon">:</span>  
<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Sketch"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.Sketch"><em>Sketch</em></a>

Part Operation: loft

Loft the pending sketches/faces, across all workplanes, into a solid.

Parameters<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **sections** (<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Vertex"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Vertex"><em>Vertex</em></a>*,*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Face"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Face"><em>Face</em></a>*,*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Sketch"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Sketch"><em>Sketch</em></a>) – slices to loft into
  object. If not provided, pending_faces will be used. If vertices are
  to be used, a vertex can be the first, last, or first and last
  elements.

- **ruled** (*bool,* *optional*) – discontiguous layer tangents.
  Defaults to False.

- **clean** (*bool,* *optional*) – Remove extraneous internal structure.
  Defaults to True.

- **mode** (<a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.Mode"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="build_enums.Mode"><em>Mode</em></a>*,* *optional*) –
  combination mode. Defaults to Mode.ADD.

<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">make_brake_formed</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span>*<span class="pre">thickness:</span> <span class="pre">float,</span> <span class="pre">station_widths:</span> <span class="pre">float</span> <span class="pre">\|</span> <span class="pre">~collections.abc.Iterable\[float\],</span> <span class="pre">line:</span> <span class="pre">~build123d.topology.one_d.Edge</span> <span class="pre">\|</span> <span class="pre">~build123d.topology.one_d.Wire</span> <span class="pre">\|</span> <span class="pre">~build123d.topology.composite.Curve</span> <span class="pre">\|</span> <span class="pre">None</span> <span class="pre">=</span> <span class="pre">None,</span> <span class="pre">side:</span> <span class="pre">~build123d.build_enums.Side</span> <span class="pre">=</span> <span class="pre">\<Side.LEFT\>,</span> <span class="pre">kind:</span> <span class="pre">~build123d.build_enums.Kind</span> <span class="pre">=</span> <span class="pre">\<Kind.ARC\>,</span> <span class="pre">clean:</span> <span class="pre">bool</span> <span class="pre">=</span> <span class="pre">True,</span> <span class="pre">mode:</span> <span class="pre">~build123d.build_enums.Mode</span> <span class="pre">=</span> <span class="pre">\<Mode.ADD\></span>*<span class="sig-paren">)</span> <span class="sig-return"><span class="sig-return-icon">→</span> <span class="sig-return-typehint"><span class="pre">Part</span></span></span>  
Create a part typically formed with a sheet metal brake from a single
outline. The line parameter describes how the material is to be bent.
Either a single width value or a width value at each vertex or station
is provided to control the width of the end part. Note that if multiple
values are provided there must be one for each vertex and that the
resulting part is composed of linear segments.

Parameters<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **thickness** (*float*) – sheet metal thickness

- **station_widths** (*Union\[float,* *Iterable\[float\]\]*) – width of
  part at each vertex or a single value. Note that this width is
  perpendicular to the provided line/plane.

- **line** (*Union\[*<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Edge"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Edge"><em>Edge</em></a>*,*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Wire"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Wire"><em>Wire</em></a>*,*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Curve"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Curve"><em>Curve</em></a>*\],* *optional*) – outline
  of part. Defaults to None.

- **side** (*Side,* *optional*) – offset direction. Defaults to
  Side.LEFT.

- **kind** (<a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.Kind"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="build_enums.Kind"><em>Kind</em></a>*,* *optional*) – offset
  intersection type. Defaults to Kind.ARC.

- **clean** (*bool,* *optional*) – clean the resulting solid. Defaults
  to True.

- **mode** (<a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.Mode"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="build_enums.Mode"><em>Mode</em></a>*,* *optional*) –
  combination mode. Defaults to Mode.ADD.

Raises<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **ValueError** – invalid line type

- **ValueError** – not line provided

- **ValueError** – line not suitable

- **ValueError** – incorrect \# of width values

Returns<span class="colon">:</span>  
sheet metal part

Return type<span class="colon">:</span>  
<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Part"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.Part"><em>Part</em></a>

Applies to 1, 2, and 3 dimensional objects.

Offset the given sequence of Edges, Faces, Compound of Faces, or Solids.
The kind parameter controls the shape of the transitions. For Solid
objects, the openings parameter allows selected faces to be open, like a
hollow box with no lid.

Parameters<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **objects** (<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Edge"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Edge"><em>Edge</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Face"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Face"><em>Face</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Solid"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Solid"><em>Solid</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Compound"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Compound"><em>Compound</em></a> *or* *Iterable of*) –
  objects to offset

- **amount** (*float*) – positive values external, negative internal

- **openings**
  (*list\[*<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Face"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Face"><em>Face</em></a>*\],* *optional*) – Defaults to
  None.

- **kind** (<a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.Kind"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="build_enums.Kind"><em>Kind</em></a>*,* *optional*) – transition
  shape. Defaults to Kind.ARC.

- **side** (*Side,* *optional*) – side to place offset. Defaults to
  Side.BOTH.

- **closed** (*bool,* *optional*) – if Side!=BOTH, close the LEFT or
  RIGHT offset. Defaults to True.

- **min_edge_length** (*float,* *optional*) – repair degenerate edges
  generated by offset by eliminating edges of minimum length in offset
  wire. Defaults to None.

- **mode** (<a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.Mode"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="build_enums.Mode"><em>Mode</em></a>*,* *optional*) –
  combination mode. Defaults to Mode.REPLACE.

Raises<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **ValueError** – missing objects

- **ValueError** – Invalid object type

Generic Operation: project

Applies to 0, 1, and 2 dimensional objects.

Project the given objects or points onto a BuildLine or BuildSketch
workplane in the direction of the normal of that workplane. When
projecting onto a sketch a Face(s) are generated while Edges are
generated for BuildLine. Will only use the first if BuildSketch has
multiple active workplanes. In algebra mode a workplane must be provided
and the output is either a Face, Curve, Sketch, Compound, or
ShapeList\[Vector\].

Note that only if mode is not Mode.PRIVATE only Faces can be projected
into BuildSketch and Edge/Wires into BuildLine.

Parameters<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **objects** (<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Edge"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Edge"><em>Edge</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Face"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Face"><em>Face</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Wire"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Wire"><em>Wire</em></a> *\|* *VectorLike* *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Vertex"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Vertex"><em>Vertex</em></a> *or* *Iterable of*) –
  objects or points to project

- **workplane** (<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_geometry.Plane"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="geometry.Plane"><em>Plane</em></a>*,* *optional*) – screen
  workplane

- **mode** (<a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.Mode"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="build_enums.Mode"><em>Mode</em></a>*,* *optional*) –
  combination mode. Defaults to Mode.ADD.

Raises<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **ValueError** – project doesn’t accept group_by

- **ValueError** – Either a workplane must be provided or a builder must
  be active

- **ValueError** – Points and faces can only be projected in PRIVATE
  mode

- **ValueError** – Edges, wires and points can only be projected in
  PRIVATE mode

- **RuntimeError** – BuildPart doesn’t have a project operation

Part Operation: project_workplane

Return a plane to be used as a BuildSketch or BuildLine workplane with a
known origin and x direction. The plane’s origin will be the projection
of the provided origin (in 3D space). The plane’s x direction will be
the projection of the provided x_dir (in 3D space).

Parameters<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **origin** (*Union\[VectorLike,*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Vertex"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Vertex"><em>Vertex</em></a>*\]*) – origin in 3D space

- **x_dir** (*Union\[VectorLike,*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Vertex"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Vertex"><em>Vertex</em></a>*\]*) – x direction in 3D
  space

- **projection_dir** (*VectorLike*) – projection direction

- **distance** (*float*) – distance from origin to workplane

Raises<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **RuntimeError** – Not suitable for BuildLine or BuildSketch

- **ValueError** – x_dir perpendicular to projection_dir

Returns<span class="colon">:</span>  
workplane aligned for projection

Return type<span class="colon">:</span>  
<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_geometry.Plane"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="geometry.Plane"><em>Plane</em></a>

Part Operation: Revolve

Revolve the profile or pending sketches/face about the given axis. Note
that the most common use case is when the axis is in the same plane as
the face to be revolved but this isn’t required.

Parameters<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **profiles** (<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Face"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Face"><em>Face</em></a>*,* *optional*) – 2D profile(s)
  to revolve.

  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="geometry.Axis"><em>Axis</em></a>*,* *optional*) – axis of
  rotation. Defaults to Axis.Z.

- **revolution_arc** (*float,* *optional*) – angular size of revolution.
  Defaults to 360.0.

- **clean** (*bool,* *optional*) – Remove extraneous internal structure.
  Defaults to True.

- **mode** (<a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.Mode"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="build_enums.Mode"><em>Mode</em></a>*,* *optional*) –
  combination mode. Defaults to Mode.ADD.

Raises<span class="colon">:</span>  
**ValueError** – Invalid axis of revolution

Generic Operation: sweep

Sweep pending 1D or 2D objects along path.

Parameters<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **sections** (<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Compound"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Compound"><em>Compound</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Edge"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Edge"><em>Edge</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Wire"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Wire"><em>Wire</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Face"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Face"><em>Face</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Solid"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Solid"><em>Solid</em></a>) – cross sections to sweep
  into object

- **path** (<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Curve"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Curve"><em>Curve</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Edge"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Edge"><em>Edge</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Wire"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Wire"><em>Wire</em></a>*,* *optional*) – path to
  follow. Defaults to context pending_edges.

- **multisection** (*bool,* *optional*) – sweep multiple on path.
  Defaults to False.

- **is_frenet** (*bool,* *optional*) – use frenet algorithm. Defaults to
  False.

- **transition**
  (<a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.Transition"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="build_enums.Transition"><em>Transition</em></a>*,* *optional*)
  – discontinuity handling option. Defaults to Transition.TRANSFORMED.

- **normal** (*VectorLike,* *optional*) – fixed normal. Defaults to
  None.

- **binormal** (<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Edge"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Edge"><em>Edge</em></a> *\|*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Wire"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Wire"><em>Wire</em></a>*,* *optional*) – guide
  rotation along path. Defaults to None.

- **clean** (*bool,* *optional*) – Remove extraneous internal structure.
  Defaults to True.

- **mode** (<a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.Mode"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="build_enums.Mode"><em>Mode</em></a>*,* *optional*) –
  combination. Defaults to Mode.ADD.

Part Operation: thicken

Create a solid(s) from a potentially non planar face(s) by thickening
along the normals.

Parameters<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **to_thicken**
  (*Union\[*<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Face"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Face"><em>Face</em></a>*,*
  <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Sketch"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="topology.Sketch"><em>Sketch</em></a>*\],* *optional*) – object
  to thicken. Defaults to None.

- **amount** (*float*) – distance to extrude, sign controls direction.

- **normal_override**
  (<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_geometry.Vector"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="geometry.Vector"><em>Vector</em></a>*,* *optional*) – The
  normal_override vector can be used to indicate which way is ‘up’,
  potentially flipping the face normal direction such that many faces
  with different normals all go in the same direction (direction need
  only be +/- 90 degrees from the face normal). Defaults to None.

- **both** (*bool,* *optional*) – thicken in both directions. Defaults
  to False.

- **clean** (*bool,* *optional*) – Remove extraneous internal structure.
  Defaults to True.

- **mode** (<a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.Mode"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="build_enums.Mode"><em>Mode</em></a>*,* *optional*) –
  combination mode. Defaults to Mode.ADD.

Raises<span class="colon">:</span>  
- **ValueError** – No object to extrude

- **ValueError** – No target object

Returns<span class="colon">:</span>  
extruded object

Return type<span class="colon">:</span>  
<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Part"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.Part"><em>Part</em></a>

<div id="topology_selection.xhtml_topology-selection-and-exploration"
class="section">

# Topology Selection and Exploration

<a href="#key_concepts.xhtml_topology" class="reference internal"><span
class="std std-ref">Topology</span></a> is the structure of build123d
geometric features and traversing the topology of a part is often
required to specify objects for an operation or to locate a CAD feature.
<a href="#topology_selection.xhtml_selectors"
class="reference internal"><span
class="std std-ref">Selectors</span></a> allow selection of topology
objects into a <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">ShapeList</code></span></a>.
<a href="#topology_selection.xhtml_operators"
class="reference internal"><span
class="std std-ref">Operators</span></a> are powerful methods further
explore and refine a
<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">ShapeList</code></span></a>
for subsequent operations.

<div id="topology_selection.xhtml_selectors" class="section">

<span id="topology_selection.xhtml_id1"></span>

## Selectors

Selectors provide methods to extract all or a subset of a feature type
in the referenced object. These methods select Edges, Faces, Solids,
Vertices, or Wires in Builder objects or from Shape objects themselves.
All of these methods return a
<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">ShapeList</code></span></a>,
which is a subclass of <span class="pre">`list`</span> and may be
sorted, grouped, or filtered by
<a href="#topology_selection.xhtml_operators"
class="reference internal"><span
class="std std-ref">Operators</span></a>.

<div id="topology_selection.xhtml_overview" class="section">

### Overview

| Selector | Criteria | Applicability | Description |
|----|----|----|----|
| <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Shape.vertices"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.Shape.vertices"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">vertices()</code></span></a> | ALL, LAST | <span class="pre">`BuildLine`</span>, <span class="pre">`BuildSketch`</span>, <span class="pre">`BuildPart`</span> | <span class="pre">`Vertex`</span> extraction |
| <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Shape.edges"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.Shape.edges"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">edges()</code></span></a> | ALL, LAST, NEW | <span class="pre">`BuildLine`</span>, <span class="pre">`BuildSketch`</span>, <span class="pre">`BuildPart`</span> | <span class="pre">`Edge`</span> extraction |
| <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Shape.wires"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.Shape.wires"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">wires()</code></span></a> | ALL, LAST | <span class="pre">`BuildLine`</span>, <span class="pre">`BuildSketch`</span>, <span class="pre">`BuildPart`</span> | <span class="pre">`Wire`</span> extraction |
| <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Shape.faces"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.Shape.faces"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">faces()</code></span></a> | ALL, LAST | <span class="pre">`BuildSketch`</span>, <span class="pre">`BuildPart`</span> | <span class="pre">`Face`</span> extraction |
| <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Shape.solids"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.Shape.solids"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">solids()</code></span></a> | ALL, LAST | <span class="pre">`BuildPart`</span> | <span class="pre">`Solid`</span> extraction |

Both shape objects and builder objects have access to selector methods
to select all of a feature as long as they can contain the feature being
selected.

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    # In context
    with BuildSketch() as context:
        Rectangle(1, 1)
        context.edges()

        # Build context implicitly has access to the selector
        edges()

    # Taking the sketch out of context
    context.sketch.edges()

    # Create sketch out of context
    Rectangle(1, 1).edges()

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="topology_selection.xhtml_select-in-build-context"
class="section">

### Select In Build Context

Build contexts track the last operation and their selector methods can
take <a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.Select"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="build_enums.Select"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">Select</code></span></a>
as criteria to specify a subset of features to extract. By default, a
selector will select <span class="pre">`ALL`</span> of a feature, while
<span class="pre">`LAST`</span> selects features created or altered by
the most recent operation.
<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Shape.edges"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.Shape.edges"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">edges()</code></span></a>
can uniquely specify <span class="pre">`NEW`</span> to only select edges
created in the last operation which neither existed in the referenced
object before the last operation, nor the modifying object.

<div class="admonition important">

Important

<a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.Select"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="build_enums.Select"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">Select</code></span></a>
as selector criteria is only valid for builder objects!

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    # In context
    with BuildPart() as context:
        Box(2, 2, 1)
        Cylinder(1, 2)
        context.edges(Select.LAST)

    # Does not work out of context!
    context.part.edges(Select.LAST)
    (Box(2, 2, 1) + Cylinder(1, 2)).edges(Select.LAST)

</div>

</div>

</div>

Create a simple part to demonstrate selectors. Select using the default
criteria <span class="pre">`Select.ALL`</span>. Specifying
<span class="pre">`Select.ALL`</span> for the selector is not required.

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    with BuildPart() as part:
        Box(5, 5, 1)
        Cylinder(1, 5)

        part.vertices()
        part.edges()
        part.faces()

        # Is the same as
        part.vertices(Select.ALL)
        part.edges(Select.ALL)
        part.faces(Select.ALL)

</div>

</div>

<figure id="id6" class="align-center">
<img src="_images/selectors_select_all.png"
alt="_images/selectors_select_all.png" />
<figcaption><p><span class="caption-text">The default <span
class="pre"><code
class="docutils literal notranslate">Select.ALL</code></span>
features</span></p></figcaption>
</figure>

Select features changed in the last operation with criteria
<span class="pre">`Select.LAST`</span>.

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    with BuildPart() as part:
        Box(5, 5, 1)
        Cylinder(1, 5)

        part.vertices(Select.LAST)
        part.edges(Select.LAST)
        part.faces(Select.LAST)

</div>

</div>

<figure id="id7" class="align-center">
<img src="_images/selectors_select_last.png"
alt="_images/selectors_select_last.png" />
<figcaption><p><span class="caption-text"><span class="pre"><code
class="docutils literal notranslate">Select.LAST</code></span>
features</span></p></figcaption>
</figure>

Select only new edges from the last operation with
<span class="pre">`Select.NEW`</span>. This option is only available for
a <span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span> of edges!

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    with BuildPart() as part:
        Box(5, 5, 1)
        Cylinder(1, 5)

        part.edges(Select.NEW)

</div>

</div>

<figure id="id8" class="align-center">
<img src="_images/selectors_select_new.png"
alt="_images/selectors_select_new.png" />
<figcaption><p><span class="caption-text"><span class="pre"><code
class="docutils literal notranslate">Select.NEW</code></span> edges
where box and cylinder intersect</span></p></figcaption>
</figure>

This only returns new edges which are not reused from Box or Cylinder,
in this case where the objects <cite>intersect</cite>. But what happens
if the objects don’t intersect and all the edges are reused?

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    with BuildPart() as part:
        Box(5, 5, 1, align=(Align.CENTER, Align.CENTER, Align.MAX))
        Cylinder(2, 2, align=(Align.CENTER, Align.CENTER, Align.MIN))

        part.edges(Select.NEW)

</div>

</div>

<figure id="id9" class="align-center">
<img src="_images/selectors_select_new_none.png"
alt="_images/selectors_select_new_none.png" />
<figcaption><p><span class="caption-text"><span class="pre"><code
class="docutils literal notranslate">Select.NEW</code></span> edges when
box and cylinder don’t intersect</span></p></figcaption>
</figure>

No edges are selected! Unlike the previous example, the Edge between the
Box and Cylinder objects is an edge reused from the Cylinder. Think of
<span class="pre">`Select.NEW`</span> as a way to select only completely
new edges created by the operation.

<div class="admonition note">

Note

Chamfer and fillet modify the current object, but do not have new edges
via <span class="pre">`Select.NEW`</span>.

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    with BuildPart() as part:
        Box(5, 5, 1)
        Cylinder(1, 5)
        edges = part.edges().filter_by(lambda a: a.length == 1)
        fillet(edges, 1)

        part.edges(Select.NEW)

</div>

</div>

<figure id="id10" class="align-center">
<img src="_images/selectors_select_new_fillet.png"
alt="_images/selectors_select_new_fillet.png" />
<figcaption><p><span class="caption-text">Left, <span class="pre"><code
class="docutils literal notranslate">Select.NEW</code></span> returns no
edges after fillet. Right, <span class="pre"><code
class="docutils literal notranslate">Select.LAST</code></span></span></p></figcaption>
</figure>

</div>

</div>

<div id="topology_selection.xhtml_select-new-edges-in-algebra-mode"
class="section">

### Select New Edges In Algebra Mode

The utility method <span class="pre">`new_edges`</span> compares one or
more shape objects to a another “combined” shape object and returns the
edges new to the combined shape. <span class="pre">`new_edges`</span> is
available both Algebra mode or Builder mode, but is necessary in Algebra
Mode where <span class="pre">`Select.NEW`</span> is unavailable

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    box = Box(5, 5, 1)
    circle = Cylinder(2, 5)
    part = box + circle
    edges = new_edges(box, circle, combined=part)

</div>

</div>

<figure class="align-center">
<img src="_images/selectors_new_edges.png"
alt="_images/selectors_new_edges.png" />
</figure>

<span class="pre">`new_edges`</span> can also find edges created during
a chamfer or fillet operation by comparing the object before the
operation to the “combined” object.

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    box = Box(5, 5, 1)
    circle = Cylinder(2, 5)
    part_before = box + circle
    edges = part_before.edges().filter_by(lambda a: a.length == 1)
    part = fillet(edges, 1)
    edges = new_edges(part_before, combined=part)

</div>

</div>

<figure class="align-center">
<img src="_images/operators_group_area.png"
alt="_images/operators_group_area.png" />
</figure>

</div>

</div>

<div id="topology_selection.xhtml_operators" class="section">

<span id="topology_selection.xhtml_id2"></span>

## Operators

Operators provide methods refine a <span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span>
of features isolated by a *selector* to further specify feature(s).
These methods can sort, group, or filter
<span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span> objects and return a modified
<span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span>, or in the case of
<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList.group_by"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList.group_by"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">group_by()</code></span></a>,
<span class="pre">`GroupBy`</span>, a list of
<span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span> objects accessible by index or key.

<div id="topology_selection.xhtml_id3" class="section">

### Overview

| Method | Criteria | Description |
|----|----|----|
| <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList.sort_by"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList.sort_by"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">sort_by()</code></span></a> | <span class="pre">`Axis`</span>, <span class="pre">`Edge`</span>, <span class="pre">`Wire`</span>, <span class="pre">`SortBy`</span>, callable, property | Sort <span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span> by criteria |
| <a
href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList.sort_by_distance"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList.sort_by_distance"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">sort_by_distance()</code></span></a> | <span class="pre">`Shape`</span>, <span class="pre">`VectorLike`</span> | Sort <span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span> by distance from criteria |
| <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList.group_by"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList.group_by"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">group_by()</code></span></a> | <span class="pre">`Axis`</span>, <span class="pre">`Edge`</span>, <span class="pre">`Wire`</span>, <span class="pre">`SortBy`</span>, callable, property | Group <span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span> by criteria |
| <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList.filter_by"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList.filter_by"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">filter_by()</code></span></a> | <span class="pre">`Axis`</span>, <span class="pre">`Plane`</span>, <span class="pre">`GeomType`</span>, <span class="pre">`ShapePredicate`</span>, property | Filter <span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span> by criteria |
| <a
href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList.filter_by_position"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList.filter_by_position"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">filter_by_position()</code></span></a> | <span class="pre">`Axis`</span> | Filter <span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span> by <span class="pre">`Axis`</span> & mix / max values |

Operator methods take criteria to refine
<span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span>. Broadly speaking, the criteria
fall into the following categories, though not all operators take all
criteria:

- Geometric objects: <span class="pre">`Axis`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`Plane`</span>

- Topological objects: <span class="pre">`Edge`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`Wire`</span>

- Enums: <a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.SortBy"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="build_enums.SortBy"><span class="pre"><code
  class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">SortBy</code></span></a>,
  <a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.GeomType"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="build_enums.GeomType"><span class="pre"><code
  class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">GeomType</code></span></a>

- Properties, eg: <span class="pre">`Face.area`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`Edge.length`</span>

- <span class="pre">`ShapePredicate`</span>, eg:
  <span class="pre">`lambda`</span>` `<span class="pre">`e:`</span>` `<span class="pre">`e.is_interior`</span>` `<span class="pre">`==`</span>` `<span class="pre">`1`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`lambda`</span>` `<span class="pre">`f:`</span>` `<span class="pre">`lf.edges()`</span>` `<span class="pre">`>=`</span>` `<span class="pre">`3`</span>

- Callable eg: <span class="pre">`Vertex().distance`</span>

</div>

<div id="topology_selection.xhtml_sort" class="section">

### Sort

A <span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span> can be sorted with the
<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList.sort_by"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList.sort_by"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">sort_by()</code></span></a>
and <a
href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList.sort_by_distance"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList.sort_by_distance"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">sort_by_distance()</code></span></a>
methods based on a sorting criteria. Sorting is a critical step when
isolating individual features as a <span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span>
from a selector is typically unordered.

Here we want to capture some vertices from the object furthest along
<span class="pre">`X`</span>: All the vertices are first captured with
the <a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Shape.vertices"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.Shape.vertices"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">vertices()</code></span></a>
selector, then sort by <span class="pre">`Axis.X`</span>. Finally, the
vertices can be captured with a list slice for the last 4 list items, as
the items are sorted from least to greatest <span class="pre">`X`</span>
position. Remember, <span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span> is a subclass
of <span class="pre">`list`</span>, so any list slice can be used.

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    part.vertices().sort_by(Axis.X)[-4:]

</div>

</div>

<figure class="align-center">
<img src="_images/operators_sort_x.png"
alt="_images/operators_sort_x.png" />
</figure>

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

#### Examples

<div id="topology_selection.xhtml_group" class="section">

### Group

A ShapeList can be grouped and sorted with the
<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList.group_by"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList.group_by"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">group_by()</code></span></a>
method based on a grouping criteria. Grouping can be a great way to
organize features without knowing the values of specific feature
properties. Rather than returning a
<span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span>,
<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList.group_by"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList.group_by"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">group_by()</code></span></a>
returns a <span class="pre">`GroupBy`</span>, a list of
<span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span> objects sorted by the grouping
criteria. <span class="pre">`GroupBy`</span> can be printed to view the
members of each group, indexed like a list to retrieve a
<span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span>, and be accessed using a key with
the <span class="pre">`group`</span> method. If the group keys are
unknown they can be discovered with
<span class="pre">`key_to_group_index`</span>.

If we want only the edges from the smallest faces by area we can get the
faces, then group by <span class="pre">`SortBy.AREA`</span>. The
<span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span> of smallest faces is available from
the first list index. Finally, a <span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span>
has access to selectors, so calling
<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.Shape.edges"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.Shape.edges"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">edges()</code></span></a>
will return a new list of all edges in the previous list.

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    part.faces().group_by(SortBy.AREA)[0].edges())

</div>

</div>

<div id="topology_selection.xhtml_filter" class="section">

### Filter

A <span class="pre">`ShapeList`</span> can be filtered with the
<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList.filter_by"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList.filter_by"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">filter_by()</code></span></a>
and <a
href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList.filter_by_position"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList.filter_by_position"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">filter_by_position()</code></span></a>
methods based on a filtering criteria. Filters are flexible way to
isolate (or exclude) features based on known criteria.

Lets say we need all the faces with a normal in the
<span class="pre">`+Z`</span> direction. One way to do this might be
with a list comprehension, however
<a href="#direct_api_reference.xhtml_topology.ShapeList.filter_by"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="topology.ShapeList.filter_by"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-meth docutils literal notranslate">filter_by()</code></span></a>
has the capability to take a lambda function as a filter condition on
the entire list. In this case, the normal of each face can be checked
against a vector direction and filtered accordingly.

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    part.faces().filter_by(lambda f: f.normal_at() == Vector(0, 0, 1))

</div>

</div>

<div id="sort_examples.xhtml_sort-examples" class="section">

# Sort Examples

<div id="sort_examples.xhtml_sortby" class="section">

<span id="sort_examples.xhtml_sort-sortby"></span>

## SortBy

<a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.SortBy"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="build_enums.SortBy"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">SortBy</code></span></a>
enums are shape property shorthands which work across
<span class="pre">`Shape`</span> multiple object types.
<span class="pre">`SortBy`</span> is a criteria for both
<span class="pre">`sort_by`</span> and
<span class="pre">`group_by`</span>.

- <span class="pre">`SortBy.LENGTH`</span> works with
  <span class="pre">`Edge`</span>, <span class="pre">`Wire`</span>

- <span class="pre">`SortBy.AREA`</span> works with
  <span class="pre">`Face`</span>, <span class="pre">`Solid`</span>

- <span class="pre">`SortBy.VOLUME`</span> works with
  <span class="pre">`Solid`</span>

- <span class="pre">`SortBy.RADIUS`</span> works with
  <span class="pre">`Edge`</span>, <span class="pre">`Face`</span> with
  <a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.GeomType"
  class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
  title="build_enums.GeomType"><span class="pre"><code
  class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">GeomType</code></span></a>
  <span class="pre">`CIRCLE`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`CYLINDER`</span>, <span class="pre">`SPHERE`</span>

- <span class="pre">`SortBy.DISTANCE`</span> works
  <span class="pre">`Vertex`</span>, <span class="pre">`Edge`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`Wire`</span>, <span class="pre">`Face`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`Solid`</span>

<span class="pre">`SortBy`</span> is often interchangeable with specific
shape properties and can alternatively be used with\`\`group_by\`\`.

<details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">

<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">

<span class="sd-summary-text">Setup</span>
<span class="sd-summary-state-marker sd-summary-chevron-right">

<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-right" viewbox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true">

<path d="M8.72 18.78a.75.75 0 0 1 0-1.06L14.44 12 8.72 6.28a.751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 0 1 0 1.06l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06 0Z"></path>
</svg>

</span>
</summary>

<div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    from build123d import *

    with BuildPart() as part:
        Box(5, 5, 1)
        Cylinder(2, 5)
        edges = part.edges().filter_by(lambda a: a.length == 1)
        fillet(edges, 1)

</div>

</div>

</div>

</details>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    part.wires().sort_by(SortBy.LENGTH)[:4]

    part.wires().sort_by(Wire.length)[:4]
    part.wires().group_by(SortBy.LENGTH)[0]

</div>

</div>

<figure class="align-center">
<img src="_images/sort_sortby_length.png"
alt="../_images/sort_sortby_length.png" />
</figure>

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    part.vertices().sort_by(SortBy.DISTANCE)[-2:]

    part.vertices().sort_by_distance(Vertex())[-2:]
    part.vertices().group_by(Vertex().distance)[-1]

</div>

</div>

<figure class="align-center">
<img src="_images/sort_sortby_distance.png"
alt="../_images/sort_sortby_distance.png" />
</figure>

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="sort_examples.xhtml_along-wire" class="section">

<span id="sort_examples.xhtml_sort-along-wire"></span>

## Along Wire

Vertices selected from an edge or wire might have a useful ordering when
created from a single object, but when created from multiple objects,
the ordering not useful. For example, when applying incrementing fillet
radii to a list of vertices from the face, the order is random.

<details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">

<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">

<span class="sd-summary-text">Setup</span>
<span class="sd-summary-state-marker sd-summary-chevron-right">

<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-right" viewbox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true">

<path d="M8.72 18.78a.75.75 0 0 1 0-1.06L14.44 12 8.72 6.28a.751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 0 1 0 1.06l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06 0Z"></path>
</svg>

</span>
</summary>

<div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    from build123d import *

    with BuildSketch() as along_wire:
        Rectangle(48, 16, align=Align.MIN)
        Rectangle(16, 48, align=Align.MIN)
        Rectangle(32, 32, align=Align.MIN)

</div>

</div>

</div>

</details>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

        for i, v in enumerate(along_wire.vertices()):
            fillet(v, i + 1)

</div>

</div>

<figure class="align-center">
<img src="_images/sort_not_along_wire.png"
alt="../_images/sort_not_along_wire.png" />
</figure>

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

Vertices may be sorted along the wire they fall on to create order.
Notice the fillet radii now increase in order.

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

        sorted_verts = along_wire.vertices().sort_by(along_wire.wire())
        for i, v in enumerate(sorted_verts):
            fillet(v, i + 1)

</div>

</div>

<figure class="align-center">
<img src="_images/sort_along_wire.png"
alt="../_images/sort_along_wire.png" />
</figure>

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="sort_examples.xhtml_axis" class="section">

<span id="sort_examples.xhtml_sort-axis"></span>

## Axis

Sorting by axis is often the most straightforward way to optimize
selections. In this part we want to revolve the face at the end around
an inside edge of the completed extrusion. First, the face to extrude
can be found by sorting along x-axis and the revolution edge can be
found sorting along y-axis.

<details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">

<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">

<span class="sd-summary-text">Setup</span>
<span class="sd-summary-state-marker sd-summary-chevron-right">

<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-right" viewbox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true">

<path d="M8.72 18.78a.75.75 0 0 1 0-1.06L14.44 12 8.72 6.28a.751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 0 1 0 1.06l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06 0Z"></path>
</svg>

</span>
</summary>

<div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    from build123d import *

    with BuildPart() as part:
        with BuildSketch(Plane.YZ) as profile:
            with BuildLine():
                l1 = FilletPolyline((16, 0), (32, 0), (32, 25), radius=12)
                l2 = FilletPolyline((16, 4), (28, 4), (28, 15), radius=8)
                Line(l1 @ 0, l2 @ 0)
                Polyline(l1 @ 1, l1 @ 1 - Vector(2, 0), l2 @ 1 + Vector(2, 0), l2 @ 1)
            make_face()
        extrude(amount=34)

</div>

</div>

</div>

</details>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

        face = part.faces().sort_by(Axis.X)[-1]
        edge = face.edges().sort_by(Axis.Y)[0]
        revolve(face, -Axis(edge), 90)

</div>

</div>

<figure class="align-center">
<img src="_images/sort_axis.png" alt="../_images/sort_axis.png" />
</figure>

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="sort_examples.xhtml_distance-from" class="section">

<span id="sort_examples.xhtml_sort-distance-from"></span>

## Distance From

A <span class="pre">`sort_by_distance`</span> can be used to sort
objects by their distance from another object. Here we are sorting the
boxes by distance from the origin, using an empty
<span class="pre">`Vertex`</span> (at the origin) as the reference shape
to find distance to.

<details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">

<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">

<span class="sd-summary-text">Setup</span>
<span class="sd-summary-state-marker sd-summary-chevron-right">

<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-right" viewbox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true">

<path d="M8.72 18.78a.75.75 0 0 1 0-1.06L14.44 12 8.72 6.28a.751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 0 1 0 1.06l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06 0Z"></path>
</svg>

</span>
</summary>

<div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    from itertools import product

    from build123d import *
    from ocp_vscode import *

    boxes = ShapeList(
        Box(1, 1, 1).scale(0.75 if (i, j) == (1, 2) else 0.25).translate((i, j, 0))
        for i, j in product(range(-3, 4), repeat=2)
    )

</div>

</div>

</div>

</details>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    boxes = boxes.sort_by_distance(Vertex())
    show(*boxes, colors=ColorMap.listed(len(boxes)))

</div>

</div>

<figure class="align-center">
<img src="_images/sort_distance_from_origin.png"
alt="../_images/sort_distance_from_origin.png" />
</figure>

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

The example can be extended by first sorting the boxes by volume using
the <span class="pre">`Solid`</span> property
<span class="pre">`volume`</span>, and getting the last (largest) box.
Then, the boxes sorted by their distance from the largest box.

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    boxes = boxes.sort_by_distance(boxes.sort_by(Solid.volume).last)
    show(*boxes, colors=ColorMap.listed(len(boxes)))

</div>

</div>

<figure class="align-center">
<img src="_images/sort_distance_from_largest.png"
alt="../_images/sort_distance_from_largest.png" />
</figure>

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="group_examples.xhtml_group-examples" class="section">

# Group Examples

<div id="group_examples.xhtml_axis-and-length" class="section">

<span id="group_examples.xhtml_group-axis"></span>

## Axis and Length

This heatsink component could use fillets on the ends of the fins on the
long ends. One way to accomplish this is to filter by length, sort by
axis, and slice the result knowing how many edges to expect.

<details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">

<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">

<span class="sd-summary-text">Setup</span>
<span class="sd-summary-state-marker sd-summary-chevron-right">

<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-right" viewbox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true">

<path d="M8.72 18.78a.75.75 0 0 1 0-1.06L14.44 12 8.72 6.28a.751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 0 1 0 1.06l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06 0Z"></path>
</svg>

</span>
</summary>

<div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    from build123d import *

    with BuildPart() as fins:
        with GridLocations(4, 6, 4, 4):
            Box(2, 3, 10, align=(Align.CENTER, Align.CENTER, Align.MIN))

    with BuildPart() as part:
        Box(34, 48, 5, align=(Align.CENTER, Align.CENTER, Align.MAX))
        with GridLocations(20, 27, 2, 2):
            add(fins)

</div>

</div>

</div>

</details>

<figure class="align-center">
<img src="_images/group_axis_without.png"
alt="../_images/group_axis_without.png" />
</figure>

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

However, <span class="pre">`group_by`</span> can be used to first group
all the edges by z-axis position and then group again by length. In both
cases, you can select the desired edges from the last group.

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

        target = part.edges().group_by(Axis.Z)[-1].group_by(Edge.length)[-1]
        fillet(target, .75)

</div>

<div id="group_examples.xhtml_hole-area" class="section">

<span id="group_examples.xhtml_group-hole-area"></span>

## Hole Area

Callables are available to <span class="pre">`group_by`</span>, like
<span class="pre">`sort_by`</span>. Here, the first inner wire is
converted to a face and then that area is the grouping criteria to find
the faces with the largest hole.

<details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">

<span class="sd-summary-text">Setup</span>

<div class="highlight">

    from build123d import *

    with BuildPart() as part:
        Cylinder(10, 30, rotation=(90, 0, 0))
        Cylinder(8, 40, rotation=(90, 0, 0), align=(Align.CENTER, Align.CENTER, Align.MAX))
        Cylinder(8, 23, rotation=(90, 0, 0), align=(Align.CENTER, Align.CENTER, Align.MIN))
        Cylinder(5, 40, rotation=(90, 0, 0), align=(Align.CENTER, Align.CENTER, Align.MIN))
        with BuildSketch(Plane.XY.offset(8)) as s:
            SlotCenterPoint((0, 38), (0, 48), 5)
        extrude(amount=2.5, both=True, mode=Mode.SUBTRACT)

            lambda f: Face(f.inner_wires()[0]).area if f.inner_wires() else 0
        )
        chamfer([f.outer_wire().edges() for f in faces[-1]], 0.5)

</div>

<div id="group_examples.xhtml_properties-with-keys" class="section">

<span id="group_examples.xhtml_group-properties-with-keys"></span>

## Properties with Keys

Groups are usually selected by list slice, often smallest
<span class="pre">`[0]`</span> or largest
<span class="pre">`[-1]`</span>, but they can also be selected by key
with the <span class="pre">`group`</span> method if the keys are known.
Starting with an incomplete bearing block we are looking to add fillets
to the ribs and corners. We know the edge lengths so the edges can be
grouped by <span class="pre">`Edge.Length`</span> and then the desired
groups are selected with the <span class="pre">`group`</span> method
using the lengths as keys.

<details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">

<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">

<span class="sd-summary-text">Setup</span>
<span class="sd-summary-state-marker sd-summary-chevron-right">

<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-right" viewbox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true">

<path d="M8.72 18.78a.75.75 0 0 1 0-1.06L14.44 12 8.72 6.28a.751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 0 1 0 1.06l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06 0Z"></path>
</svg>

</span>
</summary>

<div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    from build123d import *

    with BuildPart() as part:
        with BuildSketch(Plane.XZ) as sketch:
            with BuildLine():
                CenterArc((-6, 12), 10, 0, 360)
                Line((-16, 0), (16, 0))
            make_hull()
            Rectangle(50, 5, align=(Align.CENTER, Align.MAX))

        extrude(amount=12)

        Box(38, 6, 22, align=(Align.CENTER, Align.MAX, Align.MIN), mode=Mode.SUBTRACT)

        circle = part.edges().filter_by(GeomType.CIRCLE).sort_by(Axis.Y)[0]
        with Locations(Plane(circle.arc_center, z_dir=circle.normal())):
            CounterBoreHole(13 / 2, 16 / 2, 4)

        mirror(about=Plane.XZ)

</div>

</div>

</div>

</details>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

        length_groups = part.edges().group_by(Edge.length)
        fillet(length_groups.group(6) + length_groups.group(5), 4)

</div>

</div>

<figure class="align-center">
<img src="_images/group_length_key.png"
alt="../_images/group_length_key.png" />
</figure>

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

Next, we add alignment pin and counterbore holes after the fillets to
make sure screw heads sit flush where they overlap the fillet. Once that
is done, it’s time to finalize the tight-tolerance bearing and pin holes
with chamfers to make installation easier. We can filter by
<span class="pre">`GeomType.CIRCLE`</span> and group by
<span class="pre">`Edge.radius`</span> to group the circular edges.
Again, the radii are known, so we can retrieve those groups directly and
then further specify only the edges the bearings and pins are installed
from.

<details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">

<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">

<span class="sd-summary-text">Adding holes</span>
<span class="sd-summary-state-marker sd-summary-chevron-right">

<svg version="1.1" width="1.5em" height="1.5em" class="sd-octicon sd-octicon-chevron-right" viewbox="0 0 24 24" aria-hidden="true">

<path d="M8.72 18.78a.75.75 0 0 1 0-1.06L14.44 12 8.72 6.28a.751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018l6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 0 1 0 1.06l-6.25 6.25a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06 0Z"></path>
</svg>

</span>
</summary>

<div class="sd-summary-content sd-card-body docutils">

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

        with BuildSketch() as pins:
            with Locations((-21, 0)):
                Circle(3 / 2)
            with Locations((21, 0)):
                SlotCenterToCenter(1, 3)
        extrude(amount=-12, mode=Mode.SUBTRACT)

        with GridLocations(42, 16, 2, 2):
            CounterBoreHole(3.5 / 2, 3.5, 0)

</div>

</div>

</div>

</details>

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

        radius_groups = part.edges().filter_by(GeomType.CIRCLE).group_by(Edge.radius)
        bearing_edges = radius_groups.group(8).group_by(SortBy.DISTANCE)[-1]
        pin_edges = radius_groups.group(1.5).filter_by_position(Axis.Z, -5, -5)
        chamfer([pin_edges, bearing_edges], .5)

</div>

</div>

<figure class="align-center">
<img src="_images/group_radius_key.png"
alt="../_images/group_radius_key.png" />
</figure>

<div class="line-block">

<div class="line">

\

</div>

</div>

Note that <span class="pre">`group_by`</span> is not the only way to
capture edges with a known property value!
<span class="pre">`filter_by`</span> with a lambda expression can be
used as well:

<div class="highlight-build123d notranslate">

<div class="highlight">

    radius_groups = part.edges().filter_by(GeomType.CIRCLE)
    bearing_edges = radius_groups.filter_by(lambda e: e.radius == 8)
    pin_edges = radius_groups.filter_by(lambda e: e.radius == 1.5)

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div id="filter_examples.xhtml_filter-examples" class="section">

# Filter Examples

<div id="filter_examples.xhtml_geomtype" class="section">

<span id="filter_examples.xhtml_filter-geomtype"></span>

## GeomType

<a href="#builder_api_reference.xhtml_build_enums.GeomType"
class="hxr-hoverxref hxr-tooltip reference internal"
title="build_enums.GeomType"><span class="pre"><code
class="sourceCode python xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate">GeomType</code></span></a>
enums are shape type shorthands for <span class="pre">`Edge`</span> and
<span class="pre">`Face`</span> objects. They are most helpful for
filtering objects of that specific type for further operations, and are
sometimes necessary e.g. before sorting or filtering by radius.
<span class="pre">`Edge`</span> and <span class="pre">`Face`</span> each
support a subset of <span class="pre">`GeomType`</span>:

- <span class="pre">`Edge`</span> can be type
  <span class="pre">`LINE`</span>, <span class="pre">`CIRCLE`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`ELLIPSE`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`HYPERBOLA`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`PARABOLA`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`BEZIER`</span>, <span class="pre">`BSPLINE`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`OFFSET`</span>, <span class="pre">`OTHER`</span>

- <span class="pre">`Face`</span> can be type
  <span class="pre">`PLANE`</span>, <span class="pre">`CYLINDER`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`CONE`</span>, <span class="pre">`SPHERE`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`TORUS`</span>, <span class="pre">`BEZIER`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`BSPLINE`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`REVOLUTION`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`EXTRUSION`</span>,
  <span class="pre">`OFFSET`</span>, <span class="pre">`OTHER`</span>

<details class="sd-sphinx-override sd-dropdown sd-card sd-mb-3">

<summary class="sd-summary-title sd-card-header">

<span class="sd-summary-text">Setup</span>
